attributes.action: Place strict guidelines on the standards of comfort to which childrens clothes are made.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A law should be passed (just as there is to ensure that toys reach a certain safety standard) to ensure a certain standard of comfort in clothing made for babies and children. 

This law should cover clothing for children up until an age at which they become able to say things such as:  

"This sharp label is scratching me," 

"This embroidered nylon motif is rubbing my leg raw,"  

"My little toe is caught in a thread halfway up the inside of my tights,"  

and 

"There is a sharp point at the top of my zip and it digs into my face."

Clothing manufactures should be made more responsible.
